ai-patthana17.33:0.2_0: Having given the immaterial states produced by the phenomena that are counterpart of
ai-patthana17.33:0.3_0: for one who is attached to the internal and external objects,
ai-patthana17.33:1.1_0: Without reprehensible people, not for the sake of non-existence, not with the object, conditions for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana17.33:1.1_1: ‘... for the sake of six things.’ ...
ai-patthana17.33:2.1_0: Not seeing the Dhamma that is not visible and not insisting on the outside, and with the cause and condition for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana17.33:2.1_1: Not seeing the Dhamma that arises in someone else’s mind, and with the support of the universal space, not with the support of those without trouble.
ai-patthana17.33:2.1_2: Without going back to the beginning, middle and end of the out-of-seeing, consciousness doesn’t give rise to grasp, and there is no cause or condition for the sake of repulsion. ...
ai-patthana17.33:2.1_3: Surely the visible objects of not having the base consisting of boundless space as object, and so on, the consciousness of the base consisting of boundless space, nor do they arise with a cause or condition.
